title: Drawing, "Ceiling Design for the Consecration of Numa, Sala di Numa Pompilius, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1802–05
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on white laid paper
markings: Watermark: GDF (upper parts of G and F are not shown)
inscribed: In pen and brown ink, lower center: consacrazione di numa/ sul monte tarpeodetto/ campidoglio
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: An augur lays his left hand on veiled head of Numa who kneels on stand before altar. At left, crowd points to appearing birds.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Ceiling Design for the Consecration of Numa, Sala di Numa Pompilius, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1802–05.
1802–05. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3451.
